diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient presented with epigastric discomfort, vomiting, and a significant decrease in appetite following a meal. Physical exam showed tenderness in the epigastric and right upper quadrant (RUQ) areas. No scleral icterus was noted, and the abdomen was soft and nondistended. The clinical presentation and examination findings were consistent with acute cholecystitis, leading to the final diagnosis.
